intro: Fimbristylis spathacea var. depauperata, commonly known as the sparse spike sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer. This variety is characterized by its reduced floral structures and is often found in disturbed or nutrient-poor soils.
